name: ManageCitrixApplications
description: Enable/Disable Citrix applications and terminate broker sessions which are using the applications.
helpMarkDown: Enable/Disable Citrix applications and terminate broker sessions which are using the applications.
author: Peter Barendse

inputs.name: BrokerServer
inputs.label: Broker server(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide a comma separated list of machine IP addresses or FQDNs.
Eg: dbserver.fabrikam.com,192.168.12.34
Or provide output variable of other tasks. Eg: $(variableName)

inputs.name: Username
inputs.label: Citrix user
inputs.helpMarkDown: Supply a username with enough permissions to Enable/Disable applications and terminate broker sessions.

inputs.name: Password
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Password for Citrix user login for the target machines.
It can accept variable defined in Build/Release definitions as '$(passwordVariable)'.
You may mark variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: UseSSL
inputs.label: Use HTTPS
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the network protocol to use for the WinRM connection with the machine(s). The default is HTTP.

inputs.name: CheckCA
inputs.label: Skip CA check
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to skip validating the authenticity of the machine's certificate from a trusted certification authority. The parameter is required for the WinRM HTTPS protocol.

inputs.name: ApplicationName
inputs.label: Application name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide a comma seperated list of applications. We use the application browser name for detection, since they are unique.
Eg: Notepad,Paint

inputs.name: Action
inputs.label: Action to perform
inputs.helpMarkDown: Stop, start, restart or remove the application pool. Note: Upon removing an application pool, all websites accociated with this pool will also be deleted.

inputs.name: Killswitch
inputs.label: Terminate active broker sessions
inputs.helpMarkDown: Terminate all broker session that use the application to disable, before disabling the application.
